Description: Shoulder sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery dinos or krater; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of naked youth riding to left on horseback (head of figure and part of one hand missing; horse's legs and head missing); rider strikes horse's rump with pronged goad; added white on saddle and possible traces of added red on horse's body.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the scene, see Alexandria 9508.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.32)
CVA British Museum 8 / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain 13, British Museum 8 (p. 20, pl. VI, no. 19)
Cook 1952 / A List of Clazomenian Pottery (p. 139, no. 3)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (P.254, no.4)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.052) (Phase 1)
